item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 24, 2025 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The earliest versions of the first C compiler known to exist (124 points | 32 comments)
2. Project Aardvark: reimagining AI weather prediction (226 points | 91 comments)
3. Japanese scientists use stem cell treatment to restore movement in spinal injury (66 points | 7 comments)
4. A proof checker meant for education (46 points | 10 comments)
5. Autology: A Lisp with access to its own interpreter (24 points | 10 comments)
6. Quadlet: Running Podman containers under systemd (165 points | 40 comments)
7. Osgint – OSINT tool to find information about GitHub user (42 points | 1 comment)
8. Aiter: AI Tensor Engine for ROCm (83 points | 27 comments)
9. HP avoids monetary damages over bricked printers in class-action settlement (81 points | 48 comments)
10. Taming Servers for Fun and Profit (20 points | 1 comment)
11. Show HN: I built website for sharing Drum Patterns (367 points | 122 comments)
12. Langfuse (YC W23) Is Hiring in Berlin, Germany ( | hide)
13. The Vatican's Latinist (2017) (76 points | 39 comments)
14. A USB Interface to the "Mother of All Demos" Keyset (266 points | 69 comments)
15. The SeL4 Microkernel: An Introduction [pdf] (233 points | 130 comments)
16. DoorDash Offering Payment Plans for Food Delivery Sparks Backlash (13 points | 1 comment)
17. The Mystery of the Oldest Writing System Remained Unsolved Until 1856 (34 points | 1 comment)
18. Supply Chain Attacks on Linux Distributions – Fedora Pagure (162 points | 46 comments)
19. First Known Photographs of Living Specimens (100 points | 31 comments)
20. Play the Virtual Organ from Arp Schnitger (108 points | 19 comments)
21. BeeFormer: CF and CBF hybrid approach for recommendation systems (26 points | discuss)
22. Total lunar eclipse over Teide crater, Tenerife – a project with many obstacles (131 points | 14 comments)
23. LangManus: An Open-Source Manus Agent with LangChain + LangGraph (84 points | 8 comments)
24. Show HN: LinkedIn sucks, so I built a better one (179 points | 180 comments)
25. 23andMe files for bankruptcy to sell itself (362 points | 296 comments)
26. Technicalities of Homeworld 2 Backgrounds (184 points | 57 comments)
27. Spaghetti science: What pasta reveals about the universe (39 points | 7 comments)
28. argp: GNU-style command line argument parser for Go (167 points | 78 comments)
29. Show HN: My iOS app to practice sight reading (10 years in the App Store) (223 points | 87 comments)
30. The Worst Programmer I Know (2023) (448 points | 308 comments)
